page.title: 18Church Bells
page.content: There are{six bells}in the belfrey of Beckwithshaw Church, each one being {dedicated}to a member of the Williams family, who paid for the building of the church. The{Tenor}bell being named Henry after father, the{5th}bell after Ellen the mother, the{4th, 3rd and 2nd}after John, Mary and Annie Dugdale children of the first marriage of Mrs. Williams The{Treble}bell being called after Joshua the child of the marriage of Mr.and Mrs. Williams. The bells were brought from London from the foundry of{Mears and {Stainbeck}- still in business today at the Whitechapel Bell Foundry. Rather a large peal of bells for such a small church.
